content.description: Left most of the two towers. Start on the right arête; clip the low bolt, climb the arête several feet until you can clip the second bolt. Establish on the face moving up and slightly left to a short crack system following the bolt line over two shallow roofs to the top. Excellent rock quality low on the climb. A bit run-out near the top.
content.location: See Faulty Towers route maps for the Towers.

content.description: Right tower, delicate face climbing requiring a tricky sequence to get through the sustained lower crux. Difficult on-sight, rewarded by superb rock quality and one of the most fun sequences in LD. Took us a while to figure this out, but the rewards are high indeed! Clearing the upper bulges means taking any rest you can find. Runout between the upper bolts.
content.location: On the right leaning tower. See route map.

content.description: Left arête on the right most tower. Easy climbing to gain access to the anchors on top of Double Fault in case you want to TR that route. Rating for the bolted section goes into the mid 5.10 range if you dont use the back wall or stem.
content.protection: 3 bolts followed by easy mid-large cam placement.
content.location: Right between Fault and Double Fault

content.description: The north facing "towers" that appear to be leaning to the right when viewed from the road and thus gave rise to the name of this area: i.e. "faulty" towers, which also happens to be the name of a tv show. The best rock quality of this area.
